sentences.en: ...a huge office tower with aircraft warning beacons on the roof.

sentences.en: A standing opaque beacon may be useful in addition.
sentences.cn: 此外,也可以使用常设的实体觇标.

sentences.en: A wreck on shore is a beacon at sea.
General Rudnicki was a moral beacon for many exiled Poles.
sentences.cn: 鲁德尼茨基将军是众多被放逐的波兰人精神上的引路人。

sentences.en: It may be a beacon to you in the darkness.
sentences.cn: 但愿它成为你用来照亮黑暗的火把.

sentences.en: Sam Hawthorne , his near - bald head standing out like a beacon , was among the others.
sentences.cn: 萨姆·霍索恩也是其中之一, 他那谢了顶的脑袋油亮油亮的, 很显眼.

sentences.en: The beacon beckoned to the pilot, the beam pointed to the target.
sentences.cn: 定向信标指挥驾驶员, 射束则指向目标.

sentences.en: The Beacon does not shine on its own Base.
sentences.cn: 灯塔照不到自己的底座(当局者迷).

sentences.en: The blink of beacon could be seen for miles.
sentences.cn: 灯塔的光亮在数英里之外都能看见.

sentences.en: The currents round the beacon were more than he could manage.
sentences.cn: 他对付不了灯塔周围的激流.

sentences.en: The only light over the deep black sea was the blink shone from the beacon.
sentences.cn: 黑黢黢的海面上唯一的光明就只有灯塔上闪现的亮光了.

sentences.en: The philosopher's thinking was the beacon to many young people.
sentences.cn: 那位哲人的思想曾是许多青年的指路明灯.

sentences.en: The yellow beacon continued to flit past the window and the rain still drummed.
sentences.cn: 灯塔的黄光又继续从窗前掠过;雨,还在淅沥地下着.

sentences.en: They regarded this theory as a beacon lighting up their advance.
sentences.cn: 他们把这种理论看作是他们前进的指路明灯.

sentences.en: When the moment is right, we will ignite the Beacon of the Liberty!
sentences.cn: 一旦成熟我们就点燃这个自由女神的火炬!
